isis.stitle: TSI 97-08-05 - False ABS Warning Lamp Illumination

geninfo.para: The Bendix ABS controller continuously monitors vehicle system voltage and checks the modulator circuit integrity. If the voltage is not stable within tolerance, the ABS warning lamp will illuminate. The fault indicated by the diagnostic LEDs will generally be a right front modulator. Conditions which can cause voltage fluctuations sufficient to cause the ABS controller to indicate a fault are an alternator problem or loose connections.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Check and repair the following conditions:

item.para: An alternator with a shorted rectifier diode or phase winding will produce erratic output which may result in ABS warning lamp illumination and low alternator output. Replace or repair the alternator. Do not replace the ABS controller or modulator.

An alternator with loose stator turns will short out under certain vibration conditions. Loose stator turns may short out when the engine is under specific load and RPM and may not be duplicated during test drive exercises. Loose stator turns can be seen by removing the alternator, removing the fan, and inspecting the stator turns. If any of the stator turns can be moved with light pressure using a pencil, or if some of the stator turns have a different color resulting from high heat, the alternator must be replaced or repaired. Do not replace the ABS controller or modulator.
Loose electrical connections at the alternator or major feed points may cause erratic voltages. Verify all connections are tight.
